title: Optimal CUR matrix decompositions.
abstract: The CUR decomposition of an  m × n  matrix  A  finds an  m × c  matrix  C  with a small subset of  c   n  columns of  A , together with an  r × n  matrix  R  with a small subset of  r   m  rows of  A , as well as a  c × r  low rank matrix  U  such that the matrix  CUR  approximates the input matrix  A , that is, || A  ---  CUR || 2  F  ≤ (1 +  e )|| A  ---  A   k  || 2  F , where ||.|| F  denotes the Frobenius norm, 0  e   A   k   is the best  m  ×  n  matrix of rank  k  constructed via the SVD of  A . We present input-sparsity-time and deterministic algorithms for constructing such a CUR matrix decomposition of  A  where  c  =  O ( k/e )  and r  =  O ( k/e )  and  rank( U ) =  k . Up to constant factors, our construction is simultaneously  optimal  in  c, r , and rank( U ).
